com.vedantatree.redmineconnector
Class DefaultDataPaginator

java.lang.Object
  com.vedantatree.redmineconnector.DefaultDataPaginator
All Implemented Interfaces:
RedmineDataPaginator
public class DefaultDataPaginator
extends java.lang.Object
implements RedmineDataPaginator

This class provides the default implementation of RedmineDataPaginator interface. TODO should we change all int to long, as record count can go in long values.

Author:
Mohit Gupta [mohit.gupta@vedantatree.com]

Method Detail

getPageSize

public int getPageSize()
Description copied from interface: RedmineDataPaginator
It returns the number of records for one page. One page is logical presentation of one call to Redmine. Redmine supports up to 100 records in one call. So page size can never be greater than 100. If any user set size greater than 100, system should raise error.

Specified by:
getPageSize in interface RedmineDataPaginator
Returns:
Number of records 'one page'/'one call to redmine' will return

getStartRecordIndex

public long getStartRecordIndex()
Description copied from interface: RedmineDataPaginator
This is the record offset for the start of iteration. It indicates that iteration over records should start from this given record number.

Specified by:
getStartRecordIndex in interface RedmineDataPaginator
Returns:
Record Number to start iteration with

nextPageRecords

public java.util.List<RedmineBDO> nextPageRecords()
                                           throws RCException
Description copied from interface: RedmineDataPaginator
This method will fetch the next page of records from Redmine and will return these records. It considers page size, page offset and total number of records.

Specified by:
nextPageRecords in interface RedmineDataPaginator
Returns:
Next page of records, if exist otherwise throws exception
Throws:
RCException

getAllRecords

public java.util.List<RedmineBDO> getAllRecords()
                                         throws RCException
Description copied from interface: RedmineDataPaginator
This method can be used to get complete data through this RedmineDataPaginator for given criteria in one go. As Redmine has limit of '100' records to fetch per call, paginator will give repeated calls to Redmine to collect all records in memory first and then will return the whole set of data. Please consider, it may consume lot of memory and system may crash in case of large amount of data.

Recommended approach is to use iteration using pages always.

Specified by:
getAllRecords in interface RedmineDataPaginator
Returns:
Whole data available through this paginator
Throws:
RCException

                 throws RCException
